Description: Papyrus bearing 4 lines of a Coptic text written on recto. Llegal document of year 11 of Ptolemy VI Philometor - sale of house in Thebes, sekh-r-djeba-hedj in missing part.
Curator's comments: M. Depauw, 'A sale of a house in Thebes on a complete papyrus rolls (P. BM EA 10678 & Brux. E 8053 & Brux. E. 8051 B-A & Brux. E 8054)' in Claes et al, Elkab and Beyond (OLA 191), 261-82.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.45-6, pl.34)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2754) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2754)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Tabbed: court plaster Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (right half only)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy VI Philometor
Associated places: Named in inscription: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
